intro: This personalized nutrition plan is designed for Nick, a 22-year-old intermediate lifter aiming to increase overall body strength, gain muscle definition in the abs, arms, and shoulders, and reduce fat in the arms and thighs. The plan is grounded in scientific evidence, focusing on sustainable dietary habits and progressive adjustments. It acknowledges personal preferences and lifestyle integration for optimal adherence and results. Feedback and self-monitoring will be incorporated mindfully to track progress and avoid rigid behaviors.

caloric_needs.calculation_method: Mifflin-St Jeor equation with activity multiplier
caloric_needs.adjustment_factors: Calculated based on estimated Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) using Mifflin-St Jeor equation, multiplied by an activity factor of 1.6 (for 6 days/week training). This provides a slight caloric surplus to support muscle growth while being mindful of fat loss goals. Caloric intake will be adjusted based on progress and body composition changes every 2-4 weeks.

macronutrient_distribution.explanation:
This macronutrient distribution is designed to support muscle protein synthesis, provide adequate energy for intense training, and maintain hormonal balance. 

**Protein (2.2g/kg):**  Sufficient protein intake is crucial for muscle hypertrophy and repair, especially during strength training. Research consistently supports higher protein intake for individuals aiming to build muscle mass.  

**Carbohydrates (5g/kg):** Carbohydrates are the primary fuel source for high-intensity workouts. Adequate carbohydrate intake ensures sufficient glycogen stores for training and recovery, optimizing performance and muscle growth. 

**Fats (1.1g/kg):** Healthy fats are essential for hormone production, nutrient absorption, and overall health. They also provide sustained energy and contribute to satiety. Prioritize unsaturated fats from sources like avocados, nuts, seeds, and olive oil.

breakfast.name: Greek Yogurt Power Bowl
alternatives: Oatmeal with protein powder and fruit
Scrambled eggs with whole-wheat toast and avocado

lunch.name: Chicken Breast Salad with Quinoa
alternatives: Tuna salad sandwich on whole wheat bread

dinner.name: Lean Beef Stir-fry with Brown Rice
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, peppers, onions) (fiber, vitamins)
alternatives: Baked salmon with sweet potato and asparagus
Chicken and vegetable curry with brown rice

breakfast.name: Protein Pancakes
alternatives: Breakfast burrito with eggs, beans, and salsa
Cottage cheese with fruit and nuts

lunch.name: Turkey Breast and Avocado Wrap
alternatives: Quinoa salad with roasted vegetables and feta cheese

pre_workout.name: Oatmeal with Fruit
alternatives: Fruit smoothie with a small amount of protein powder

dinner.name: Baked Chicken Thighs with Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: 1.5 cups roasted vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers) (fiber, vitamins)

breakfast.name: Egg and Spinach Scramble
alternatives: Protein smoothie with spinach and berries

lunch.name: Salmon Salad with Sweet Potato
ingredients: 1 medium baked sweet potato (complex carbs, vitamin A)

dinner.name: Chicken and Vegetable Skewers with Couscous
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (peppers, zucchini, onions) (fiber, vitamins)

lunch.name: Lentil Soup with Whole Wheat Bread
ingredients: 2 cups lentil soup (fiber, protein, complex carbs)

dinner.name: Ground Turkey and Black Bean Chili
ingredients: Spices and herbs (chili powder, cumin, etc.)

breakfast.name: Whole Wheat Toast with Avocado and Egg
alternatives: Smoked salmon and cream cheese on whole-wheat bagel (smaller portion)

lunch.name: Tuna Salad Sandwich on Whole Wheat
ingredients: Celery and onion (optional for crunch and flavor)
alternatives: Chicken wrap with hummus and vegetables

dinner.name: Pizza with Whole Wheat Crust and Chicken
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (peppers, mushrooms, onions) (fiber, vitamins)
1/4 cup part-skim mozzarella cheese (lower fat cheese)
alternatives: Homemade burgers on whole-wheat buns with lean beef
Fajitas with chicken or beef and whole-wheat tortillas

breakfast.name: Weekend Brunch: Omelette with Vegetables and Whole Wheat Toast
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (peppers, onions, mushrooms) (fiber, vitamins)
alternatives: Pancakes with protein powder and fruit (moderate portion)
French toast with whole-wheat bread (moderate portion)

lunch.name: Out to Lunch: Grilled Chicken Salad (Choose Wisely)

macros.fats: 30g (Estimate, ask for dressing on the side)

ingredients: Light vinaigrette dressing (on the side to control amount)
alternatives: Sushi (choose lean fish and brown rice)
Soup and salad (choose broth-based soup and salad with lean protein)

pre_workout.name: Optional pre-workout snack if needed based on training time and intensity
ingredients: Consider options from previous days (banana, rice cakes, fruit)
Adjust based on hunger and workout duration
alternatives: Skip if not hungry or workout is short

dinner.name: Social Dinner: Lean Protein with Vegetables and Smart Carb Choice
ingredients: Lean protein source (fish, chicken, lean beef)
Smart carbohydrate choice (brown rice, quinoa, sweet potato)
Be mindful of sauces and dressings – ask for them on the side
alternatives: Restaurant meal with mindful choices and portion control

breakfast.name: Relaxed Breakfast: Waffles with Protein and Fruit (Moderate Portion)
ingredients: 1 scoop protein powder (mixed with water or milk and used as 'syrup')
alternatives: Pancakes with protein powder and fruit (moderate portion)
Bagel with cream cheese and smoked salmon (moderate portion)

lunch.name: Leftovers from Dinner or Simple Salad with Protein
ingredients: Leftovers from Saturday dinner (reheat and enjoy)
OR Large salad with grilled chicken or fish (if no leftovers)
alternatives: Sandwich with lean protein and vegetables

pre_workout.name: Active Rest Day - Optional Snack
ingredients: If engaging in light activity, a small piece of fruit may suffice
If a more intense activity is planned, consider a pre-workout snack similar to other days
alternatives: Small handful of nuts and seeds

dinner.name: Home-Cooked Comfort Meal: Roast Chicken with Vegetables
ingredients: 1.5 cups roasted root vegetables (carrots, potatoes, parsnips) (complex carbs, fiber)
2 tbsp olive oil (for roasting vegetables) (healthy fats)
alternatives: Shepherd's pie with lean ground beef and sweet potato topping
Homemade lasagna with whole-wheat noodles and lean meat/vegetables
